messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] music math
messages.msgSnippet: ... Now here s the scary part -- I have 2 degrees in music, and was never required to take any math courses.  I understood all the computational rules, but
messages.messageBody:
> And - SHEESH - imagine teaching musical notation to a kid who hasn't ever
> heard music?
>
> Schools teach math to kids who have no equivalent of having "heard music".
> They have no relevant context.

Now here's the scary part -- I have 2 degrees in music, and was never
required to take any math courses. I understood all the computational
rules, but back then, I didn't have a clue of the reasons behind it all.

Hmmmm, do you think the fact that I didn't really understand fractions might
possibly explain all the problems I had with rhythm my first couple years of
college music classes? (sigh)

brenda
